Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: The ratio of boys to girls in a family is 5:7. The total number of children in the family is 180. If the boys are given $3900 to share, how much money does each boy receive?<n>Answer: 52<n><n>Input: Josephine receives a bill from the hospital for 5000$.  50 percent of the bill is for medication.  25 percent of the remaining bill is for overnight stays, and 175$ is for food.  The rest of the bill is for the ambulance ride.  How much did the ambulance ride cost?<n>Answer: 1700<n><n>Input: It was time for Kelly to harvest her carrots that she had planted in three different beds.  In the first bed she pulled out 55 carrots.  In the second bed she pulled out 101 carrots and in the third bed she pulled out 78 carrots.  She found that 6 carrots weighed one pound.  How many pounds of carrots did Kelly harvest?<n>Answer: 39<n><n>Input: Iris’ family is planning a surprise birthday party for her. The party will include her 3 uncles and 4 aunts who have a son and daughter each as well as her brother and mother. In total, how many people are coming to Iris’ birthday party?<n>Answer: 23<n><n>### Input:To locate a choker not located in a jewelry box or boutique where would you go? Choices:  A: jewelry store B: neck C: jewlery box D: jewelry box E: boutique<n><n>### Response:		Answer C:  jewelry box<n><n>### Instructions: Write an expression that represents the situation. You may use variables, constants and variables, and/or logical terms.<n><n>### Input A: A person, for 16 years, has paid $30 per week.<n><n>### A1: Input $30/week.<n><n>### Response A1:16 years<n><n>### Instruct1:  An artist paints 12 pictures. In what number of years will this person have painted 120 pictures?<n><n>### Instraction A: Choose one answer choice and write its response in the space provided.<n><n>### [A2,A3,A4,A5]<n><n>### A) A2: The artist has made 120 paintings.<n>### B) A3: The artist has painted 120 paintins<n>### C) A4: The artist has painted a total of 720 paintings.  <n>### D) A5: The artist has made for a total of 120 years.<n>

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: The ratio of boys to girls in a family is 5:7. The total number of children in the family is 180. If the boys are given $3900 to share, how much money does each boy receive?<n>Answer: 52<n><n>Input: Josephine receives a bill from the hospital for 5000$.  50 percent of the bill is for medication.  25 percent of the remaining bill is for overnight stays, and 175$ is for food.  The rest of the bill is for the ambulance ride.  How much did the ambulance ride cost?<n>Answer: 1700<n><n>Input: It was time for Kelly to harvest her carrots that she had planted in three different beds.  In the first bed she pulled out 55 carrots.  In the second bed she pulled out 101 carrots and in the third bed she pulled out 78 carrots.  She found that 6 carrots weighed one pound.  How many pounds of carrots did Kelly harvest?<n>Answer: 39<n><n>Input: Iris’ family is planning a surprise birthday party for her. The party will include her 3 uncles and 4 aunts who have a son and daughter each as well as her brother and mother. In total, how many people are coming to Iris’ birthday party?<n>Answer: 23<n><n>### Input:James felt himself losing consciousness.  He was frightened.  He didn't want this.  He was scared of what? Choices:  A: death B: coma C: peace D: forgetfulness E: loss of life<n><n>### Response:		The answer is A.  He didn' feel calm at this point.<n><n>### Input : What is the rule? Choices: A:  If you hear 911, dial 911 B:  If it is 911, don't answer C:  If it is not 911, answer D:  If you don't hear 911 hang up E: All of these would be rules<n><n>### Response :  The answer is B. The rule is simple:  It is 911.  There wasn't any other numbers after that so it was a direct answer to that question that the rule meant.<n><n>### <n><n>### Input 1: Mary was working in the garden and all of a sudden a lightening bolt flashed.  Where was she when she felt the presence? Choice: A: Inside her house B:  Outside her house to the right of the garden C:  Outside her yard in the middle D:  Outside her garden, E: In her bathroom<n><n>### Response-  Mary was inside her garden.  Outside doesn't mean just the area around her garden but the general area.<n><n>###   Input 2: Which of these describes the weather in the mountains during June? Choice: a: cool and rainy b: hot and humid c: cool and humid d: hot and cool<n><n>###  Response- It is cool and humid in the mountains.<n><n>###                <n><n>### Input- If x=5 and y=-2 what is x + y? Choice: A- 3 B- 5 C- 2 D- 7 E: 1<n><n>### Response   x+y gives you 7.<n><n>### Now we test this scenario with the 2nd answer which is answer 5 or 2.<n><n>### What is x + x-2 =?  Choice:  A- 3 B 5 C- 3 D- 4 e- -1<n><n>### The answer is D.<n><n>

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. The total number of children in the family is 180. If the boys are given $3900 to share, how much money does each boy receive?<n>Answer: 52<n><n>Input: Josephine receives a bill from the hospital for 5000$.  50 percent of the bill is for medication.  25 percent of the remaining bill is for overnight stays, and 175$ is for food.  The rest of the bill is for the ambulance ride.  How much did the ambulance ride cost?<n>Answer: 1700<n><n>Input: It was time for Kelly to harvest her carrots that she had planted in three different beds.  In the first bed she pulled out 55 carrots.  In the second bed she pulled out 101 carrots and in the third bed she pulled out 78 carrots.  She found that 6 carrots weighed one pound.  How many pounds of carrots did Kelly harvest?<n>Answer: 39<n><n>Input: Iris’ family is planning a surprise birthday party for her. The party will include her 3 uncles and 4 aunts who have a son and daughter each as well as her brother and mother. In total, how many people are coming to Iris’ birthday party?<n>Answer: 23<n><n>### Input:When you play around with your dog they will have? Choices:  A: alive B: health C: fun D: playing dead E: black<n><n>### Response:		The statement with the best match between question and answer is A.<n><n>### Input:(Human) The number of people who have been on earth for one year equals 6x10^24.  What is the human population of the earth as of October 22, 2010?<n><n>### Dem:<n>Input: The answer to the question is 76<n>Input: (Human) The population of the earth as I understand is 76x10^4 people <n><n>Input: How many square inches of 2" x 4" are there in 275 cubic feet?<n><n>### Input/Dem:(Human) Two third of 20 <n><n>### Input/(Dem) 14

Choices:  A: depressed B: downcast C: angry D: unhappy E: sorrowful<n><n>### Response:		The correct choice is [E: sorrowful]<n><n>### Input:"I'm so thirsty, that I'd give you everything and more just to get a drink," is an example of_______?<n><n>### Response:"I'm so mad I'm going to kill you," is an example of________.<n><n>### Input,"When will the sun set?", is an example of a______sentence?<n><n>### Input"The teacher gave the students a long-winded speech about the subject matter that is a snooze fest for the students" is a sentence that ______.<n><n>### Input "When will I be able to buy the car I want?" is an example of a ______ question.<n><n>## Input:  The car-rental company charge $25/day for a car and a $60/day surcharge if tax return is made.  On a recent trip, Mary is charged the following fees for her rental.  What is the total charge for the 3-day-rental of the vehicle?<n><n>## Response:The tax surcharge, 120 is included. The total charge is 255.50.<n><n>## Solution:<n>In this solution, we break down each task in detail so you can fully understand the structure of a programming solution.<n><n>***Instruction 1:How much, in dollars, do they pay?***<n><n>First, we need to read the instructions.<n><n>Then we break the question down step-by-step:<n>1. Question: A: 30 + 190? 5<n>2. Total: ____________<n><n>>**Solution:** In step 1 of the solution, we create two variables to store the inputted answer (30) and the days being rented. And in step 2, we use the `sum` module to add the days being rented (5) to the answer. And finally in the `answer` variable, our solution calculates the total by entering the sum and 3 days into the `answer` variable `answer=310`. This is displayed in Figure 2.<n><n><img src="./assets/images/instruction/1.png" alt="Instruction 1 Solution" class="img-responsive"><n><n><img src ="./

In total, how many people are coming to Iris’ birthday party?<n>Answer: 23<n><n>### Input:Where would you find a bee gathering pollen? Choices:  A: united states B: sky C: court D: field of flowers E: orchard<n><n>### Response:		<n>> **D** There is a bee gathering on an orchard.<n>### Instructions:A student's score on a math test was 38. If she was allowed to make up a test by adding her total number of incorrect questions to the total number of correct questions, which of these would be the highest possible score?<n>### Demonstation:<n>* Choice A: 112<n>* Choice B: 96<n>* Choice C: 100<n>* Choice D: 86<n>* Choice E: 110<n><n>### Repsonse:<n>> **A** In order for the highest score, She must add all the wrong answers to her right answers.<n><n>### Inputs:1) a student has a math test, with 8 wrong answers to 4 correct so they must add the 8 wrong answers to the 4 right answers 2) I have a bag of marbles that contains 5 yellow marbles, 4 purple marbles and 8 brown marbles. How many of each type of color of marbles are there? How many of each color are there?<n>### Demostration:<n>* Choice B<n>* Choice A<n><n>### Reponse:<n>1) Add the 8 wrong ones to the 4 right ones so you get a new number.<n><n>2) Add 4 to 5 and get 9, add 8 to 4 and get 12, add 8 to what? so you get 8 yellow, 2 purple and 5 brown.<n><n>### Dummy Instructions:The student who is taking math test has ____ total wrong answers. The number of correct answers is _____. The number of marbles that are present in the _____ color marbles.  We know the answer of 2+4+6 we need 2 of one color and 4 of next color and 6 of the last color.<n><n>### Reponce:<n>>Add 4 to 5 you get 9, add 8 to 3 you get 12, you already know the amount of the last color answer so you dont need to keep adding for that one.<n><n>### Demo Inputs:<n>1) 17, 33, 26, 9, 8

Rewrite each of the problem statements, using the sentence starters provided in parentheses and your own words.  When writing the response, try to explain how you use the sentence starters to build your response.<n><n>### Sentences starters<n>I like to take care of my car so that it will stay in good condition and work well when I need it.<n>I like to (1) ______________________ and (2) ______________________ my car. This (3) ______________________.<n><n>I like to (4) ______________________ because it (5) ______________________. (6) ______________________. I like it (7) ______________________. It's fun.

If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: The ratio of boys to girls in a family is 5:7. The total number of children in the family is 180. If the boys are given $3900 to share, how much money does each boy receive?<n>Answer: 52<n><n>Input: Josephine receives a bill from the hospital for 5000$.  50 percent of the bill is for medication.  25 percent of the remaining bill is for overnight stays, and 175$ is for food.  The rest of the bill is for the ambulance ride.  How much did the ambulance ride cost?<n>Answer: 1700<n><n>Input: It was time for Kelly to harvest her carrots that she had planted in three different beds.  In the first bed she pulled out 55 carrots.  In the second bed she pulled out 101 carrots and in the third bed she pulled out 78 carrots.  She found that 6 carrots weighed one pound.  How many pounds of carrots did Kelly harvest?<n>Answer: 39<n><n>Input: Iris’ family is planning a surprise birthday party for her. So yes.<n><n>### Input #3:The price for 2 large pizzas is $20 with a 25% discount and $15 with a 15% discount.  For the 25% discout how much is it? Choices:  B: $25 C: $35 D: $15 E: $40<n><n>### Response B: $25, The answer is the sum of the two choices<n><n>A pizza is $20, because there are 2 pizzas, you can multiply the $ to get the answer<n><n>### Input 4: 6+4 20 0/20 2.5/5 1.5 13/10 11/80 43/42 54-15 <n><n>### Response 43, the answer is the sum of all the choices(sum)<n><n>### Inputs:1. The answer is a.<n><n>The price of two pizzas is $15 each. <n>For $20, you can order 2 pizzas.<n><n>### Response #6: For $190 in rent, Jennie will pay $30 for one day, $3 for half a day, and $3 for three quarters of a day. Thus, her total bill will be $33.<n><n>### The answer you gave is the same as part a of the problem.<n><n>The car rental agency charges $33 every time they rent a car. <n><n>So if she rents a car for one week and more, her rental will cost $190. <n><n><n>

Infinite, because without it we cannot comprehend concepts like continuity, limits, rational numbers, irrational numbers, integers.  The next most important number is... e.  And it's just as important as "infinite" because without it, we cannot do calculus.  And the next most important number isn't even a number - it's pi.  It's just as important to math as 0, as 1, as infinity, as a prime, and as a rational or irrational.<n><n>[Watch a video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4mAe4wuOQIY)<n>

Choices:  A: running B: have fun C: balls touch D: winning E: get tired<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Description: Input is a string that contains seven lower case letters representing one of the following letter pairs: (1) running, (2) have fun, (3) balls touch, (4) getting tired, (5) winning, (6) (7) Competition.<n><n>### Output:  The output is the string "C" which is the only string that does not contain any of the letters above, it instead must contain letters from options (c) and (d)<n><n>### Input<n>Carl’s dog has 3 pairs of socks, each sock has 3 pairs of shoes and 3 pairs of shoelaces.  If Carl has a pair of shoes on and is not wearing a hat, how many pairs of socks can he have? (assume the dog is not wearing a sweater and that pants are not worn with socks)<n><n>Carl’s answer: 2<n><n>### Explanation:<n>Option one: Carl will have an unbroken circuit between socks and shoes.  This means he has worn a different shoe with a sock, different shoe with different sock, and different shoe with a different sock.   Since there are 3 socks, there are 2 different circuits.<n><n>Option 2: Carl has worn every pair of shoes with every individual sock.  He also has worn every pair of heellaces with every pair of shoes.  This totals up 6 loops, so he has worn 6 different pairs of socks.<n><n>### Inputs:<n>Carl’s cat has 4 different ties and 2 different sweaters. She has only 1 pair of shoes and 4 pairs of socks.  If Carl’s cat is not wearing a tie and has two shoes on, how many pairs of shoes are wearing? (assume the cat is not wearing pants).<n><n>Carl’ss answer: 1/4<n><n>### Explantation:<n>Option 1: Carl has worn every tie with every sock and sweater.  He has worn every sweater, tie, and sock with every shoe.  This adds up to 12 pairs of shoes.<n><n>Option 4:  Carl has also worn every tie with every shoe and

Fourteen years later, the population tripled.  How many years did it take for the population to triple?<n><n>Output:<n>12<n><n>### Response<n>We first notice that in 12 years the population in a town doubled.  We then notice that 12+12- years later the population tripled. Then we notice that the last 14 years the population has tripled.  This gives us the 14 years.<n><n>### Input and Output<n>The population of a county doubled every 20 years.  What was the population of this county twenty years ago?<n>Output:<n>320, 640, 1280, 2560<n><n>### Response to Input<n>The county's population doubled every 2 years -10 years ago the population was 640, which means one year earlier it was 320.<n><n>### Hint<n>One year earlier: (20-10) = 20<n><n>### Input <n>He bought a new car for $35,000 and traded it in as a loss of $3000 a year and a half later he sold the car for 60% of what it sold for the first time. What year did he sell it for the second time?<n><n>### Response,<n>After 1 year he had it for 8000 $, but after a year and half he had it for 6400$, it meant that he made 20%. 8000 divided by.2 is 40,000, 2 years later he had the car of 64000, which means he sold it for 140%. 6400/140 is equals to 20 years.<n>### Input<n>There are 12 bells, each of which rings once  every  24 minutes. How  long does it take the bells  to  fill an hour?<n>Output:<n>9 hours.<n><n>### Response.<n>If each bell rang once every 24 minutes it means that each bell made a cycle of 24 minutes, then 60 x

Topic sentence ­­­_______________________________________________________________________­___________________________________________________________________ _______________ The car-rental company charges $30 per day for cars. A car will be worth $190 for over a week. Jennie rented the car for ten and eight days. 310 is the amount she had to spend for the rental. A hurricane is heading to the south of Texas. 400 cattle should be moved to higher ground to stay safe from inland flood damage. The truck carries twenty head of cows. 60 miles per day, four hours are needed to get all the cattle to safe territory. 40 hours are how long it will take to transport my cattle by car. 800 dollars is what Eric pays to rent the 20 days. There is 72 hours when you consider all the time it takes to drive and get back home from town. $3900 was the amount we gave the boys. They received $52 each. There is 50 percent is going to be allotted to medication bills. Another 12.5% is going to be from overnight stays, and the remaining 6.37% is going to be the food. 1700 is going to be the price of the ambulance ride from home to hospital. 78 carroots were harvested from the first bed. 101 carrot roots were harvested from number two. 55 carrot roots were harvdred from the third bed. 6 carrot roots weighed on pounds. Iris has three uncles and four aunts. Each aunt and uncle had a daughter and son, and her mum and borthre had six children, making fifteen people in total.<n><n>### Input:-145 in a bag is 50% of the content of the bag. How much is the whole bag worth?<n><n>### Response:-150<n><n>### Instuctions:The whole bag would be worth $150. 50 percent of the contents are $500-145=355, and 145 is ¼ of 620

He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: The ratio of boys to girls in a family is 5:7. The total number of children in the family is 180. If the boys are given $3900 to share, how much money does each boy receive?<n>Answer: 52<n><n>Input: Josephine receives a bill from the hospital for 5000$.  50 percent of the bill is for medication.  25 percent of the remaining bill is for overnight stays, and 175$ is for food.  The rest of the bill is for the ambulance ride.  How much did the ambulance ride cost?<n>Answer: 1700<n><n>Input: It was time for Kelly to harvest her carrots that she had planted in three different beds.  In the first bed she pulled out 55 carrots.  In the second bed she pulled out 101 carrots and in the third bed she pulled out 78 carrots.  She found that 6 carrots weighed one pound.  How many pounds of carrots did Kelly harvest?<n>Answer: 39<n><n>Input: Iris’ family is planning a surprise birthday party for her. The party will include her 3 uncles and 4 aunts who have a son and daughter each as well as her brother and mother. In total, how many people are coming to Iris’ birthday party?<n>Answer: 23<n><n>### Input:What would children do if they are bored? Choices:  A: walk B: change shoes C: play tag D: smell smoke E: reach over<n><n>### Response:		If this is the case then they should walk.<n><n>### Input<n>Input: A group of 33 friends have decided to meet up for a picnic lunch at the park. There are a total of 17 boys and 16 girls at the park with them. 56 individuals eat at the picnic lunch, how many friends are girls? <n><n>### Answer<n>Five times seven equals?<n><n>### InputThe teacher asks for each row to contain one number.<n>Input:  1  2.    4.           7.    3.       5.    4 6 7.          9     <n>        7  8  3<n><n>        6<n><n>Input:  Three plus three equals <n><n>### Response1 + 2 = 3<n><n>### Deduct: If Sarah was 6 years old when her baby brother was born, how old is Sarah now?  <n><n>### Instructions.  Sarah was 6 when her baby brother was borne. Three years have passed since her brother was born so  she is 9.<n><n>### Direction:In the example below 4+2=6  <n><n>###  A: Answer the next 9 addition problems using your mental math.<n><n>### AnswerThe sum of the numbers is 21<n><n>### Question.How can you reduce this number to 20?<n><n>### Answer:Take one away<n><n>### Step 1<n><n>### Find the largest number.<n><n>### Step2<n><n>### Subtract from previous answer<n><n>### Step3<n><n>### Add one and subtract from initial sum<n><n>### Add all the numbers below, and write the sum below:<n><n>### A single number 4 is added to itself again and again till it is 20.<n><n>### How many times 4 is added to 4?<n><n>### 584<n><n>### Question 3<n><n>## Input:How can you reduce this to 20? <n><n>## Deduct: A: Add two to the number and subtract one.<n><n>## B:  Subtract one and divide by the remaining number.<n><n>## C: Reverse the order of the number and subtract 7.<n><n>## D: Add 2 and subtract 9.

Choices:  A: apartment B: classroom C: buildings D: car E: audience<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>The answer to this question is “A.” Apartment could contain no more than 100 people. Choices A and D could not contain “around 100” as apartments and buildings cannot move or change size and therefore cannot be contained within any space like a car. Classroom contains no more than 12 to 17 students. Classrooms or school buildings are used for education purposes and not for living reasons. Lastly, a car is not a building but a 4-wheeled vehicle. A car is not a permanent residence like building.<n><n>-----------------------------<n><n>

How much will it cost to rent the car for 1 week?<n><n>  <n><n><n>    C# programming<n>    ```C#<n>    class Program<n>    {<n>        static void Main(string[] args)<n>        {<n>            double firstDayCharge = 3;//add 3 for first day charge<n>            double secondDayCharge = 16.0;<n>            double thirdAndEveryDayCharge = 9.925D;<n><n>            double dailyCharge = firstDayCharge;<n><n>            int days = 3;<n><n>            double WeeklyCharge = days * 3 * dailyCharge / 100;<n><n>            Console.WriteLine("How much, in dollars, for the week? = {0}", WeeklyCharge);<n>        }<n>    }<n>    ```<n><n>* How to solve a question with multiple options:<n><n>In

The human body naturally has a homeostatic mechanism to keep the concentration of this substance within the same range. However, if this substance level in the bloodstream is too high or too low, negative feedback will take place causing either a downward or upward trend in the level. What, in terms of biology, is the substance with this type of homeostatic mechanism?<n><n>### Response 2:A<n>### Input 3:During a time of famine, 2 farmers have one cow, but one cow must be fed in total, while two cows must be fed between them. The following information describes some time during which the famine continues. The feeding schedule is as follows: The first farmer feeds his cow by cutting some stalks from his cornfield and adding some water to them in a bucket, then mixing it with the cow’s food. After feeding his cow, this farmer must be given two stalks of his corn to plant for next season. The second farmer cuts some stalks from his oats field, combines them with his cow's food, then returns all of the leftovers and remnants of the stalks together back to the field. After feeding his own cow he will be given one stalk of oats to plant for next season, and the following time the farmer who first fed his cow takes his turn to feed himself. The famine is so severe that the crops have suffered heavily to the point where the corn stalks and oats stalks are both extremely weak and withered. When cutting the stalks from either type of field, a farmer can only cut 2 stalks per field in total at any given time. If the cows are properly fed, how many stalks will need to be cut at any given time during the famine?<n><n>### <n><n>### Input  4:In a large city, the roads are laid out in a grid with 864 blocks. Choices:  A: reverse B: backwards C: back and D: back and E: tally back<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>---<n><n>I agree and I can see how one would use the expression "go forth, also this." as an illustration to give more depth of the understanding. If I were on the fence about whether or not this expression may be used in this context, then I would ask, "Does it make sense to use "go forth, also that" in this context?" The expression "go forth" when used alone would have me confused because there would be nothing to go forth to, but if I use the expression, "go forth, also the this or that with the following statement, "go forth my deer" or (in this case) "go forth, also my dog" then I could then see the meaning and would understand it and agree it can be used.<n><n>### Inputs:Iris’ family is planning on a surprise birthday party. E:23<n><n>## Input:If you have a number and you want to know what the remainder is when you divide it by eight, what do you do. 1/8, 3/8, 5/8 <n><n>### Response<n><n>---<n><n>The remainder is equal to the number represented in fraction form minus the quotient. The division process I know is the opposite. One of the few subjects I actually remembered from being in school. The division part of me says the answer is 7, but to be mathematically correct, the answer given is 1 which is the correct answer. I am going to say I believe that the remainder is equal to what is represented in the fraction and if the remainder is equal to 1 over 8 then the result should be 1 over 8, but if I need to find to see the remainder and know what that means, then is the correct answer 3 over 8. That would make sense to me because there would now be another 1 over 8 remaining and so then, the remainder would be that 1 over 8 again. I could see if there were two 3 over 8 then there would be a remainder of 1 over 8. If however, the rest of the fraction was simply 2 over 8 then the remainder would be 1 over 18. I could see how this could apply to any number in the denominator, but it would

Choices:  A: having appointements B: being late C: have time to think D: time consuming E: impatience<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Explanation:A,B and D are not correct.<n>C is not correct.  We have a lot of time to think while waiting for our doctor appointments. <n>E is not correct.  There will be lots of impatient people while waiting for the doctor.<n><n><n>### Input-Task:A pond has a surface area of 4321 square centimeters.  The pond rises 41 centimeters above the ground.  What is the volume, in cubic centimeters, of the pond?<n><n>### Demo:<n>Answer: 19013<n><n>### Step:<n>Input: We can use volume formula to answer this question.<n><n>**Volume of a 3-dimensional object is a measure of the amount of 3-dimensional space it takes up.  Or we can use a measure of how much room an  object takes up in 3 dimensions**.<n><n>The volume of one pond in the world is:<n><n>**V = l x w x h**<n><n>Input: The above equation describes how to calculate the number of units in a 3d geometric structure.<n><n>### Process:<n>The following points are the variables that we can use and the corresponding units.<n><n>**V =**<n><n>L = **Length** Units:**Inches** **cm** **Meters**<n><n>W =** Width ** Units:Inches **cm** **Meter**<n><n>H = **Height** Units: **Inches** **cm  **Meter**<n>### Output:<n><n>L =   41  Units: Inches<n><n>W =   41  = Units: Inches<n>H = 41  Units:Inches<n><n>### Output: Answer: Volume of one pond in world is:<n><n>V = ( 41 x 41 x 0 ) = 54,361 square Inches.   30 inches = 1 square foot.<n><n>In other word the volume of one pond is 186270 square feet in the pond.<n><n>### Discussion:We can see the steps above, the answer we got is not correct.<n><n>If we change our maths in the second step.<n><n>Change Height:  41 Inches to 2

This problem set includes problems in which I will need your help.<n><n>For your final score, I will need your solutions and how long it takes you to complete the problems (for your answer to be counted)<n><n>I have given you more time to complete this problem set to give you ample time to complete the problem set.<n><n>I expect you to hand in the solutions to every problem I give.<n><n>Everything counts.<n><n>### Problem 1<n>Write a function named “mySquareRoot” that takes the integer argument “myNum” and returns the square root by integer division.<n><n>Examples:<n><n>```<n>mySquareRoot(23)<n>Returns 5 because 5 x 5 = 25 (23^0.5)<n>mySquareRoot(-8)<n>Returns 2 because -2 x -2 = 4 (9-1-1-1-...-1)<n>mySquare(5)<n>Returns 10 because 10 x10 = 100 (99-1-9-9 -...-1-9-...)<n>mySquareRoot7<n>Returns 3 because 3 x 3 = 11 (0 - 1 - 10)<n>```<n><n>Note that you won't have to deal with negative numbers but if you were to hand in a negative number, it will be the solution.<n><n>### Commentary<n>I have given you a basic guide of how to solve this problem but I have not solved it for you. You will learn from scratch by my helping you. I want you to learn from scratch.<n><n>### Help<n><n>```<n>Here is what I am expecting. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: The ratio of boys to girls in a family is 5:7. The total number of children in the family is 180. If the boys are given $3900 to share, how much money does each boy receive?<n>Answer: 52<n><n>Input: Josephine receives a bill from the hospital for 5000$.  50 percent of the bill is for medication.  25 percent of the remaining bill is for overnight stays, and 175$ is for food.  The rest of the bill is for the ambulance ride.  How much did the ambulance ride cost?<n>Answer: 1700<n><n>Input: It was time for Kelly to harvest her carrots that she had planted in three different beds.  In the first bed she pulled out 55 carrots.  In the second bed she pulled out 101 carrots and in the third bed she pulled out 78 carrots.  She found that 6 carrots weighed one pound.  How many pounds of carrots did Kelly harvest?<n>Answer: 39<n><n>Input: Iris’ family is planning a surprise birthday party for her. The party will include her 3 uncles and 4 aunts who have a son and daughter each as well as her brother and mother. In total, how many people are coming to Iris’ birthday party?<n>Answer: 23<n><n>### Input:What chore might a child have to do after breakfast, before getting on the bus? The product’s unit cost is $30 and its unit purchase price is $20. 2 of these items are currently on sale for $50 each, but once this sale has ended they will return to the previous unit price of $30.  I could choose to buy it now as it is $30 (I need one for now), or wait it out and purchase it for $50 when the sale ends for later use.  Since the item’s unit cost is higher at the sale price, this is an advantageous investment.<n>Output: I should buy these now.<n><n>### Input (rephrased)<n><n>Input: I am planning to buy a house. Choices:  A: advertisement B: magazine C: store D: web page E: bus<n><n>### Response:		<n>The correct answer of this is the job dancing and waaiving.<n><n>### Input The zoo is raising money for a new elephant enclosure. There are three ways to contribute: a one-time cash contribution, a $5 monthly contribution, or a $200 one-time contribution. How many different amounts of money can the zoo collect for this project?  121<n>### Response: The correct answer is: If you multiply the cash, monthly and the one time contribution, you will get 121.<n><n>### Question :A person owns three acres of land. He wants to plant two seeds per square foot. If one plant takes up 6 square feet, and each plant produces 20 seeds, how many seeds total can the person plant on the acres if he wants to get a total of 300 seeds?<n>### Answer: If you multiply the first number 2 by the second number 6, you get 12<n>If you multiply the first number by the second number you get 1<n>Since every second number adds up to 12, you have to multiply the first number by (12-1)+1, which is 11<n>We do not need all the seeds so, if we multiply 300 by 11, we get 3300<n><n>### Input A man bought 54 eggs for 76 cents. How much would 13 eggs cost? E:10.22 cents<n>### Answer: You must multiply 13 by the amount per egg in cents, which is 0.076<n><n>### Input : John has 23 quarters. Additional quarters don't matter. How much money is in his hand?<n>### Answer :<n>If you sum up the amount of quarters by multiplying them together, you get $5.50<n><n>### Question: A man who owns three acres of farm property decides to make a square garden on the land he owns. How many rows will he have to plant his plants on? You must multiply 3 by 3 to get 9.

The party will include her 3 uncles and 4 aunts who have a son and daughter each as well as her brother and mother. In total, how many people are coming to Iris’ birthday party?<n>Answer: 23<n><n>### Input:Dry and cracked heels are found on? Choices:  A: boot B: the desert C: loaf of bread D: foot E: hock<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Input: D<n><n>Input: A boy's class had 54 children.  39 of these children were girls.  4/5 more boys than girls were in the class.  <n>What was the class size? <n>Answer: 99<n><n>### Input<n><n>He is a great fisherman.<n><n>The last piece of the puzzle was found.<n><n>This is not a great movie.<n><n>She did not go to the meeting at work.<n><n>### Your Response:<n><n>Easy, fun, hard, great, good, etc.<n><n>### Input and Response:<n><n>I am a caring person.<n><n>She has beautiful green eyes.<n><n>They will be great with the new addition.<n><n>Today was a great day to be outside.<n><n>### What is your age?<n><n>100+<n><n>100<n><n>99<n><n>79<n><n>1<n><n>### Input-Response:<n><n>The sun is a star.<n><n>The sun is not a star.<n><n>I am very busy tomorrow.<n><n>### Multiple choice Input/Response:<n><n>Hardly anyone is playing volleyball tonight.<n><n>I am playing volleyball tonoght.<n><n>### Single Choice A/B Input/Response:<n>I hate going to school.<n>I hate going to work.<n><n>## Multiple Choice Selection Task:<n>Select the correct answer in response to the question. <n><n>### How many bison were slaughtered in 1873?<n><n>30, 100, 500, or 700<n><n>### Select the correct answer<n><n>In _2003_ the United States produced 750 million bushels of barley, 400 million bushels of rye, and 160 million bushels of wheat.  In ______ the United States produced one million bushels of rice.<n><n>1993, 2004, 2005, or 2006<n><n>### Select The correct answer<n><n>What is the value of 3 x 4 x 6 x 7 x 8?<n><n>64, 720, or 6561<n><n>### How

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. The rest of the bill is for the ambulance ride. In which decade was the following event?  1985  II. 1977 A. True.  B. False.  C. Yes.  D. No.  E. Cannot be determined.  III. 1980  II. 1789  2. Which country celebrates Oktoberfest?  3. Which term describes a person who does not believe in the existence of God?  4. The first recorded Thanksgiving was celebrated by colonists who had lived in what present-day North American country?  5. Which famous American leader is included on the $20 bill?  6. When was the Declaration of Independence signed?  7. Which of the following is not a reason why some early settlers did not participate in the Mayflower Compact?  8. Who was the first governor of Massachusetts Bay Colony?  9. How many stars are on the American flag?  10. Who is responsible for the First Continental Congress?<n>Answers: 1) C 2) D 3) C 4) E 5) D 6) B 7) C 8) B 9) A 10) A Demonstration of correctness: The first 8 questions have 4 options.<n>Which one was true from the answers A, B, C, D.<n><n>### Input Answer: 9) 5<n><n>### Demotation of correctness:  11) C<n><n>### Input Answers:11)E 12)A <n><n>### Demotion of correctness:<n>### 13)B<n><n>14) D<n><n>15) A<n><n><n>### Input ANSWERS: 16) B 17) D<n><n>### Demote correctness:<n><n><n><n>### References:<n><n>[1] This problem was a part of NIST's Coding System Security Standard. They are called "RSA-74". (n.d.). http://csrc.nist.gov/publications/nistpubs/1369/nist-sp/74.09.pdf. Retrieved May 8, 201

(The building was built in 1970.)<n><n>### Response<n>> The Eiffel tower (Chosen as the tallest but actually built in 1889)<n><n><n>```python<n>    def task1():<n>        number_people = int(input("How many people are coming to your birthday party? "))<n>        choice = str(input("where's a lot of offices in new york? "))<n>        return "Choice"<n>    def task2():<n>        building_tallest = str(input("What is the tallest building in world when built? "))<n>        correct_building = str(input("what's wrong? "))<n>        number_year = int(input("What year? "))<n>        time_year = int(str(number_year))<n>        if time_year <= 1800:<n>            time_year = time_year + 1800<n>        elif time_year > 1800 and lesser than time_year:<n>            time_current_year = time_current_year + 1<n>        else:<n>            time_end_year = time_end_year + 10<n>        print("Toward the end of the " + str(time_year) + ", the " + str(number_people))<n>        return "year"<n>    def task3():<n>       return "year"<n>```<n>

It has a specialization of pens. <n><n>

The rest of the bill is for the ambulance ride.  How much did the ambulance ride cost?<n>Answer: 1700<n><n>Input: It was time for Kelly to harvest her carrots that she had planted in three different beds.  In the first bed she pulled out 55 carrots.  In the second bed she pulled out 101 carrots and in the third bed she pulled out 78 carrots.  She found that 6 carrots weighed one pound.  How many pounds of carrots did Kelly harvest?<n>Answer: 39<n><n>Input: Iris’ family is planning a surprise birthday party for her. The party will include her 3 uncles and 4 aunts who have a son and daughter each as well as her brother and mother. In total, how many people are coming to Iris’ birthday party?<n>Answer: 23<n><n>### Input:Where can you store a small notepad on your person? Choices:  A: back pocket B: meeting C: drug store D: home E: school<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Let us start with a list of possible choices that have not yet been labeled. Let our first choice be called A. If we put A next to it we have.<n>1.Back pocket<n>2.Meeting<n>3.Drug store<n>4.Home<n><n>Now let us add choice B.<n>[ ]Home<n>[X]Back pocket<n>[ ]Meeting<n>[ ]Drug store<n>[ ]School<n><n>Next we go to choice C.<n>[X]Home<n>[X]Meeting<n>[ ]School <n>[ ]Drug Store <n>[ ]Bedroom<n><n>Let us continue on to choice D.<n>[X]School<n>[ ]Meeting <n>[X]Drug Store <n><n>Let us continue this pattern until we get to choice E.<n>[X]Meetings <n>[X]Schools<n>[X] Drug store<n><n>Now you cannot remove choice A because it is now checked off <n>[X]*Home<n>Now you cannot remove choices B,D and E because they have been checked off. This leaves us with only one possible choice.<n>[ ]Meeting.<n><n>### Input<n>There are 7 boys named Jack, Joe, Jo, and Joey and 5 girls named Sue, Sophie, Jasmine, and Sarah. If a group of 2 boys and 2 girls are to be picked at random, how many possible combinations can be formed?<n><n>### Response<n>The first thing we need to do is to decide what each of the variables (Boys and Girls) will be. Let us call all the girls "J", and all the boys "B".<n>The next thing we can think about is the number of possibilities that we have for each combination. First we have to note that "BJ" is not a possibility because we have already assigned B to both Jack and Joe.<n>Now that we have thought about what the possible combinations could be lets see how many total possible combinations we have.<n>[ ]BJ[ ]BJs[ ]J[ ]Js[ ]SB[ ]SBj[ ]SJs<n><n>This is one of the possibilities but we don't know which one we want.<n>Now lets subtract all the ones that we don't want.<n>[ ]BJS[ ]JSB[ ]JBs[ ]SBJ[ ]JSb[ ]SBs

He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: The ratio of boys to girls in a family is 5:7. The total number of children in the family is 180. If the boys are given $3900 to share, how much money does each boy receive?<n>Answer: 52<n><n>Input: Josephine receives a bill from the hospital for 5000$.  50 percent of the bill is for medication.  25 percent of the remaining bill is for overnight stays, and 175$ is for food.  The rest of the bill is for the ambulance ride.  How much did the ambulance ride cost?<n>Answer: 1700<n><n>Input: It was time for Kelly to harvest her carrots that she had planted in three different beds.  In the first bed she pulled out 55 carrots.  In the second bed she pulled out 101 carrots and in the third bed she pulled out 78 carrots.  She found that 6 carrots weighed one pound.  How many pounds of carrots did Kelly harvest?<n>Answer: 39<n><n>Input: Iris’ family is planning a surprise birthday party for her. The party will include her 3 uncles and 4 aunts who have a son and daughter each as well as her brother and mother. In total, how many people are coming to Iris’ birthday party?<n>Answer: 23<n><n>### Input:The teachers needed to get their classrooms ready for the school year.  What is one thing they might do? One thing they might do is Open boxes.<n>### Input:How many more days are in October than in February? Choices:  None    A: 24    B: 30    C: 34    D: 29<n><n>### Response<n><n>How many more days are there in October than February?  If there were 30 days in February, then 30 fewer days than that would be in October.  Thus the answer is D: 29.<n>### Input <n>Jim goes to the store to buy groceries.  As he approaches the store, he can’t find a parking spot.  He parks two streets away even though he has a new sports car that could park much closer to his destination.  Which of the following choices is it most likely that this represents?<n><n>A: He didn’t know how far he was going to the store.   B: He decided to get a sport bike and now can’t find a spot for it. C: The store is far from where he lives and he would rather move into a town home within walking distance of the store.  D: The street has more parking than the place he usually parks.  Answer: B<n><n><n><n><n><n>

This is called “tunnel vision”. This makes it harder to judge distances, see colors, identify movements and objects (especially moving ones), or perceive contrasts (such as bright light or night).<n><n>They might also start seeing distorted images, blurry visions or even hallucinations.<n><n>### Additional comments:<n>Please give appropriate feedback, thank you.<n>

You have three choices regarding what to do with them:<n><n>1.  Return them to the nest.<n>2.  Do nothing.<n>3.  Keep them for yourself.<n><n>""".center(100, "*"))<n>for number in range(5):<n>   print("A. {letter}. {number}.  B. {letter}. {(number+1)}.  C. {letter}. {<n>    (number+1)}.  D. {letter}. {1}.{nextprint(number+1)}.".format(letter=choice_letters[number],<n>    number=number+1,<n>    *print_format)<n>   time.sleep(0.5)<n>```<n>

Choices:  A: come home B: airplane C: learn from each other D: go out E: make art<n><n>### Response:		 A<n><n>### Instructions: You might think that Sam could go home and forget about the people he met while<n>traveling, go out to parties, learn from the people he met, and do those who he met wrong to get<n>revenge. However, Sam could come home and not make any other contact with the people he met.<n><n>### Below is an instruction that gives steps to follow to solve a problem.  Each step can be followed to successfully solve the problem.  Choose one of those steps and write a response that explains how to successfully solve the problem by completing the step you choose.<n><n>### Step 1:<n>In the first step to solving the problem, we were given two equations that we needed to use in order to figure out what the first variable is. So, we will multiply both of those equations by 1 and the left hand side will be:<n><n>$$XL = 80$$<n><n>$$YL = 32$$<n><n>We can now add those two equations together to eliminate the variable L. So, after that addition we get:<n><n>$$X + Y = 112$$<n><n>### Step2:<n>It is now time to turn the question into its equivalent equation to solve the equation. So, we divide the unknown by four:<n><n>$$X/4 = 1832$$<n><n>The first step was to use a two step equation to solve for the unknown. We need the values of both the first variable and the second variable in order to find the value of the first variable. So, we used the second value of our given two equation when we added them together.  <n><n>### Choices: Choice A: $$X = 2932$$<n><n>Choice B: $$X = 4245$$<n><n>Choice C: $$X = 14292$$<n><n>Choice D: $$X = 8094$$<n><n>Choice E: $$X =112$$<n>

B: dreams -Dreams are thoughts and visual images that occur in the sleeping person's mind. C: have nightmar<n><n>### Questions:1.Which type of weather is colder than the other? A: raining B: fogging up on the windshield C: strong winds D: snow E: no reason<n><n>### Response Options:-A is hot, B is cold, C is windy but A is colder, D is cold, E is hot. -The word “cool” means the temperature is not warm. The opposite of that temperature is hot. 3.The only season that has a thunderstorm is the summer season. 4.The “windshield” means the piece of glass in front of the steering wheel or in the front of the car that gives the driver a good view of the road. These wi<n><n>### Question: What type of weather does the word “Sunny” indicate?<n><n>### Response:-The type of weather is called “sunny”. Choices:  A: waterfalls B: underwater C: beach D: surface of earth E: river<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### The answer to this question depends on the input of the other variable.<n><n>#### Here's what you'll do first:<n><n>    let waterfalls;<n>    let underwater;<n>    let beach;<n>    let surfaceOfEarth;<n>    let river;<n><n>#### Then ask for the amount of variable 1 (the answer) then get the amount of variable 2 (The other choice).<n><n>#### Here' the logic:<n><n>### Dem<n><n>> **Demonstration:**<n>><n>> _The variable named in the task is the answer to a question that may or may not have been asked during the demonstration._ <n>> <n>> **Demonstrable:**<n>><n>* A carpenter is building shelves in a person’s house. The shelves are 6.2 feet high and the person wants to know if there is enough room to stack a box of building supplies on his shelves.<n>* The carpenter begins with a box. He cuts off a one foot long piece of the box of building supplies as a sample. The one foot long piece of box weighs 3 pounds. (How much does the full box weigh?)<n>* He measures an inch off the top of the box then weighs the block. He gets 7 pounds. (How much is that per foot?)<n>* Using that information, he knows that the box of building supplies will fit on the shelf if it is less than 6.2 feet deep. So he places the box of building supplies against the shelf and it fits perfectly.<n>* He calls the person and tells him that the box will fit. So he makes another box of building supplies and places those building supplies on the shelf.<n>* He walks away from the shelf he knows that it will not fit. How much does the box need to be cut off the top in order to fit on the shelf?<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>The second box does not need to be cut.<n><n><n><n><n><n>### Dem:<n><n><n><n>## Instruction: Write a code that will read a word that can be found within the text below.<n><n>### Input<n>		1001101110100010100<n><n>### Demostration<n>		A

Her sister, Sharon, said it all came down to careful planning.  "You need to take the time to know where you can go next," she explained.  "If you can go around an obstacle, do that.  It will save time and keep your sanity."  "But what if the obstacle is so high that you can't get over it or under it?  Then what?""In that case, you backtrack from where you are.  But be careful, because it may not be easy to figure out where to go next."<n><n>### Response(A): This is a tricky question<n>### Response(B): It is hard to get out of the maze using this tactic<n>### Response(C): Backtracking is a good thing to do in this type of situation<n>### Response(D): If you are stuck in a maze, you need to figure out whether you can get around the obstacle<n>### Response(E): It is harder to figure out where to get if you backtrack<n>### Response(F): Backtracking can get harder to know where to turn next<n><n>###<n><n>### Input"How long have you been in the hospital?" enquired the doctor to the patient. He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: The ratio of boys to girls in a family is 5:7. The total number of children in the family is 180. If the boys are given $3900 to share, how much money does each boy receive?<n>Answer: 52<n><n>Input: Josephine receives a bill from the hospital for 5000$.  50 percent of the bill is for medication.  25 percent of the remaining bill is for overnight stays, and 175$ is for food.  The rest of the bill is for the ambulance ride.  How much did the ambulance ride cost?<n>Answer: 1700<n><n>Input: It was time for Kelly to harvest her carrots that she had planted in three different beds.  In the first bed she pulled out 55 carrots.  In the second bed she pulled out 101 carrots and in the third bed she pulled out 78 carrots.  She found that 6 carrots weighed one pound.  How many pounds of carrots did Kelly harvest?<n>Answer: 39<n><n>Input: Iris’ family is planning a surprise birthday party for her. The party will include her 3 uncles and 4 aunts who have a son and daughter each as well as her brother and mother. In total, how many people are coming to Iris’ birthday party?<n>Answer: 23<n><n>### Input:Where could you find a laundry room that is only used by staff? Choices:  A: house B: hotel C: green house D: college E: dorm<n><n>### Response:		The only place you could find a laundry service that isn’t open to the public is a college. People who live in a dorm or rent a room in a hotel have access to the coin machines in these buildings. Students are the only people who rely on the machines to do their laundry.<n><n>### Question: Is it better to be 1 hour early or 1 minute late for an appointment? Choices:  Ticket A Ticket B Ticket C<n><n>### Response It is much better to be 1 minute early than to be 1 minute late. The appointment will be ready for you just as soon as you get there, and waiting for you at the end because you are the next person to see the appointment.<n><n>### Input :  Why was the traffic slow? Which road is that on? Choices : A: I-5 B: 101 C: 395 D: HWY 99<n><n>### Response : It was because of an accident, with one lane blocked. The accident was blocking the 395, which is highway 99.<n><n>### question: In the diagram, the 2:1 ratio represents _____.  <n>Choices :  A: 4 men to 2 men  B: 2 men to 4 men<n><n>### Response The 2:1 ratio is the ratio of 6 men to 3 men. This ratio is also called the 6:3 ratio.<n><n>### instruction: Which number in this ratio is the larger number?<n><n>### Dem: 6:9 10/25      8:10 3/5     6:7      86:458<n><n>### Dem:-17:11        - 9:12 48/24 51:72   -37:133    -9:12   -12:5<n><n>### response: The numbers that are larger than the numbers that are smaller are the ones that belong to the set of numbers that start  with smaller sets of numbers.<n><n>### A: Choice 6:9 B: Choice -37:153 C: Choice 51:71 D: Choice 40:24<n><n>### A : Choice 4

The ratio of sisters to brothers is 3:5. The number of children in the house is 29. How many boys are there?"<n><n>### Response:"There are 24 boys and 5 girls in the house."<n><n>### Solution:"The number of boys are 24+5=29 = 24 since there is 4 more boys that there are girls."<n><n>### Response2:<n>When I saw the two sets of numbers, I immediately knew that the boy : girl ratio was in favor for the boys so if we were to say the amount of girls is 5 (since the numbers have 3 girls more than boys) then we would use X to represent girls and 3 for boys. Since there is 3/4 of girls to boys, the amount of girls is (5x3)/4. Since they give us the 1st number in the 1st set and the second number in the 2nd set, we know that if there are 29 kids then the amount of boys is X-3(29). Since there are no more than 29, the girls has to be equal to the boys. X=24<n><n>### Input : How many cars are parked in the school parking lot<n><n>Answer : "120 Cars"<n><n>### Solution<n><n>```python<n>cars = int(input(''))<n>print(cars*2)<n>```<n><n>## Explanation :<n><n>1 * 2 is equal to 2<n><n>The program calculates 120*2 to multiply 120 (the amount of cars in the lot) by 2 to get the outcome of 240.<n><n>120 / 2 is not equivalent to 60<n><n>### Solution2:<n><n>```python<n><n>cars = int (input(''))<n>factor = 1.5<n>total_cars = factor*cars

If the boys are given $3900 to share, how much money does each boy receive?<n>Answer: 52<n><n>Input: Josephine receives a bill from the hospital for 5000$.  50 percent of the bill is for medication.  25 percent of the remaining bill is for overnight stays, and 175$ is for food.  The rest of the bill is for the ambulance ride.  How much did the ambulance ride cost?<n>Answer: 1700<n><n>Input: It was time for Kelly to harvest her carrots that she had planted in three different beds.  In the first bed she pulled out 55 carrots.  In the second bed she pulled out 101 carrots and in the third bed she pulled out 78 carrots.  She found that 6 carrots weighed one pound.  How many pounds of carrots did Kelly harvest?<n>Answer: 39<n><n>Input: Iris’ family is planning a surprise birthday party for her. In total, how many people are coming to Iris’ birthday party?<n>Answer: 23<n><n>### Input:When having food at a formal place, what do you usually do? The children are all happy in the new house <n><n>### Response 2:The children are all happy in a new house.<n><n>### Response for the instruction:Answer the following multiple-choice question<n><n>### Input : The bus can hold 10 more than the number of passengers. Choices:  A: in the basement B: west C: solar system D: beach E: beans<n><n>### Response:		<n>Option B. There are about 600 million miles between the sun and Earth, or about 8.3 light-minutes. That is one-twelfth the distance to Proxima Centauri—a mere 7.6 light-years away. The nearest star—the red dwarf Proxima Centaury—is about 25,000 times fainter than the sun. That's not just a lot of stars to get around, but the light from them is so sparse that we can not detect a galaxy until it is hundreds of millions of light years away.  There are more than 1,000 galaxies visible to the naked eye.<n><n>### Input:# of minutes taken for one person to drive to work (e.g. 43, or 16)<n># of minutes one should be on the phone once they are at work (e.g., 55, or 16, or 0)<n># of minutes used to check e-mail (e.g., - 16)<n><n>### Response:# of minutes one person takes to travel to work each day: 25<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following question in the table below.<n>Input: It cost 13 dollars to rent a video and 4 dollars to rent a board game and you can rent multiple board games. The function f(x) is defined by the following table:    <n>### 111<n>### 13<n><n>### Write a function that correctly implements the table.<n><n>### f(x) = <n><n>x |    |  <n>----|-----   <n>**21**|**111**|<n>**22**|**13**|<n>**23**|**11**|<n><n>### You may find it useful to enter each input/output pair on a separate line in a table.<n>### You may also find it helpful to print a representation of your function in the format used by the table. For example, 11 13.<n><n>### The function should use recursion because each input x is an element of the set {21, 22, 23} and there may be any number of possible outputs that the function f defines.<n><n>### Write tests for your function by including input values (and expected output values) for each input/output pair.<n><n>### Test Case 1:<n>### Input: 20<n>### Output: 101<n><n>### Your Solution:<n>### test.py:<n>```python<n>class Solution:    <n>     def my_funtion(self, x):<n>         <n>          while self.index<len(x):<n>            if x[self.index]==int((self.index+6)/6)*x[self.index+6]:<n>              self.number = self.number+self.index+6<n>            else:<n>             <n>              self.index = self.index+6<n>             return self.number<n>             return x<n><n><n>```<n><n><n><n>### Test 2<n>### Input:<n><n>```python<n>Input: 21<n>Output: 111<n>```<n><n><n>### Your solution<n><n>```python<n>class Sol:<n>     def my_function(self,x):<n>             <n>           if(x== int((self.index-1)+4)%6*int(self.index+4)):<n>              self.number=self.number+self.self.index-1<n>              self.

How much change does the attendant give them?<n><n>### Response : The answer is.8 dollars and 6 cents.<n><n>### Response This problem is given to introduce the concept of the number line.  Note that the number line begins at 0 and goes increasing by 1's.  It ends at 10.  The car rental cost is $30 per day plus $190 for 8 days or a total of 190 + 30 * 8 = 640 dollars.  In the number line, we have 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 and 7.  Between 0 and 1, it is 1 day and between 1 and 2, it is 2 days and so on. (30/day * 1) + (30/days * 2 + 30/days *?) = 30 + 60 + 90 = 180 dollars.  Between 60 and 61, it is 2 dollars. Between 61 and 62, it is 3 dollars.  If Jennie rented the car for less than 8 days, the car rental cost would still be 80 dollars.  If it rented the car for 9 days, the car renter would have had to pay 9 dollars. The answer should be 4 or 9 dollars for the amount that Jennie overpaid.<n>    <n>### Input:<n>    1. What

Choices:  A: feel cold B: feel pressure C: feel bumpy D: itches E: feel clammy<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### **Example:**<n><n>The skin gets pinched and itches. And the person can’t see it. The skin feels bumpy and clammy if it gets damaged.<n><n>### **Explanation:**<n><n>Skin is made up of cells, each of which have an outer part called a epidermis and an inner part called a nucleus. The epidermis layers and holds the skin cells together. The nucleus is the heart of the cell and is in charge of all the other activity in the cell. If the cells get damaged, the skin itches.<n><n>### Inputs: (A-D, A)<n><n>An A, like A in this case, is a complete sentence, meaning the user has a question, and then answers it with the second choice (like b, c, or d). In cases like this one, you should not assume that the answer is the letter A. You can assume nothing of your reader’s writing style unless explicitly stated.<n><n>### Explanation<n><n>This question was asking for a complete sentence with no additional context. The best answer was _D_.<n><n>### Input (A, A to A)<n><n>An ‘A’, like A in this example, is a complete sentence meaning that the user has asked a question, and then answered it with the third choice (like a to a). In cases like this, you can assume nothing of your readers’ writing style unless explicitly stated<n><n>### Explantion<n><n>This question was asked for an answer consisting of three words. Thus, the best answer was a, as it was the only acceptable answer.<n><n>### Example<n><n>The user wrote that a cow is a quadruped.<n><n>### Solución<n><n>Correct. The user is correct in assuming that a cow is a mammal.<n><n>### Cuestiones:<n><n>### **Instrución:**<n><n>Answer the following question.<n><n>## Cuestiones:<n>* Cuestion 1:<n>        Input: The car-renta agency charges 30 dollars per day for a car and 190 dollars for the first week for car rental in excess of week. Otherwise, add a vowel letter after it.<n><n>Return your string as an output on one line, with no spaces and with a return character included. You may assume that the input always has the proper order of letters, and that it always contains a vowel. When a vowel is removed, you may assume that no other letters were removed (but again, this cannot be assumed to occur if the vowel is added, since removing a vowel letter may invalidate the input). <n><n>Input: “the cat” Output: “et the cat” <n><n>Input: "kitty" Output: "tty " <n><n>Input: "" Output: "o" <n><n>Input:"o" Output:"o " <n><n>Input:"p"Output:"pp " <n><n>Input"cat" Output:"cat"<n><n>Input: "cat" Output: “p” <n><n>Input "p" Output: “pt” <n><n>Input"pqr" Output "pqr"<n><n>Input"p" Output: "p qr"<n><n>### Instructiion:<n>Given the string, create two words by interchanging the last two characters of the input and removing all spaces in between those two characters. <n><n>* Input: p<n>* Output: px<n><n>* Input: x<n>* Output: xy<n><n>* Input: s<n>* Output: ns<n><n><n><n><n><n>###### DO NOT ALTER THE CODE BELOW

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. The rest of the bill is for the ambulance ride.  How much did the ambulance ride cost?<n>Answer: 1700<n><n>Input: It was time for Kelly to harvest her carrots that she had planted in three different beds.  In the first bed she pulled out 55 carrots.  In the second bed she pulled out 101 carrots and in the third bed she pulled out 78 carrots.  She found that 6 carrots weighed one pound.  How many pounds of carrots did Kelly harvest?<n>Answer: 39<n><n>Input: Iris’ family is planning a surprise birthday party for her. The party will include her 3 uncles and 4 aunts who have a son and daughter each as well as her brother and mother. In total, how many people are coming to Iris’ birthday party?<n>Answer: 23<n><n>### Input:Where would you be able to hear a bassoon played in an unpleasing fashion? If there are 2 additional people that assist the installer at no charge, how much does it cost to hang the fan?<n><n>### Response<n><n>A<n><n>### Instructions: <n><n>You will be given two mathematical statements and asked to either multiply or divide to obtain the correct answer.<n><n>### Response Instructions<n><n>To answer the problem, multiply or divide as needed.  For example, if “b” was 12 and “c” was 7, then the solution would be “12 divided by 7” or “12 times 7”.<n><n>### Demo:<n><n>**Demonstration:**<n><n>12 \/ 24  <n><n>**24 divided by 12**<n><n>12 divided by 24  <n>12 \* 24  <n>240 divided by 12<n><n>12 divided <n><n>12 \*3<n><n>

Her family will include her mother, brother, and 5 grandparents; her mother has 2 sons and a daughter, her father has 2 daughters, and her brother also has a daughter.<n><n>### Input : What could you take away a line from? Choices: A: grass B: play C: bus stop D: line E: post office<n><n>### Response :<n><n>The bus will leave at exactly 3:45 and will arrive at its destination at 5:10 PM.<n><n>### Test:What is the total number of cattle that John can haul?<n><n>### Response<n><n>Jennie rented a car from the car rental agency for 11 days, and paid one day’s rate ($30/day) for an additional day and also paid a one-time charge of 190 dollars for a week of rental of the car.  The total amount Jennie paid for the rental is the sum of (11*30) + (1*190) = 310 dollars.<n><n>### Reference: <n>Tutorials Point (I) Pvt. Choices:  A: appreciation of nature B: become educated C: excitement D: increased knowledge E: see things differently<n><n>### Response:		It is hard for me to disagree that science often changes ones point of view but I disagree with the other choices made above.<n><n>**Appreciation**<n><n>I like science and I like to learn. At some point I've appreciated nature. I haven't taken a trip to the beach just to stare at the ocean but I do look and think about the life in it instead of always just thinking about the beauty.<n><n>**An Education**<n>I have always been interested in science and have learned a moderate amount of science. I think science can be entertaining but not my number one interest I'm inquisitive like that :)<n><n>**Excitement**<n><n>I don't think I have experienced excitement after having learned the science behind something. I've had the chance to learn about a great deal of stuff and I think I have a fairly good grasp on a lot of the stuff out there in the world and the way various scientific concepts can come into a play. Science has a habit of explaining things in ways that are more interesting or in one's vocabulary rather than in ways that create excitement.<n><n>**Increased Knowledge**<n><n>I have noticed that it seems the things that create excitement are not things that are easily explained nor easily understood by many. Science is a system and a way to learn things but it can be a dry way of learning things. I think it provides the most complete understanding of things but one need to work hard to have an understanding of various scientific concepts.<n><n>**Seeing things differently**<n><n>Seeing things differently could either mean looking at an object, a concept, or someone you care about and thinking "I don't see you this way any more" or "I was ignorant to your existence and was wrong to think that way and I'm sorry I did" or I could think that I am different than you after I've been to the beach and experienced one's love for the ocean or I could see the world differently because of science. I think when someone says this it implies that their point of view has changed and that it changed because of science or knowledge.<n><n>### Input The time-zones of US states and foreign countries.<n>### Response:<n>**US Time Zones:**<n><n>The Time and Date website states that the time zone in the United States "spans four time zones. The contiguous states use Eastern,

If the boys are given $3900 to share, how much money does each boy receive?<n>Answer: 52<n><n>Input: Josephine receives a bill from the hospital for 5000$.  50 percent of the bill is for medication.  25 percent of the remaining bill is for overnight stays, and 175$ is for food.  The rest of the bill is for the ambulance ride.  How much did the ambulance ride cost?<n>Answer: 1700<n><n>Input: It was time for Kelly to harvest her carrots that she had planted in three different beds.  In the first bed she pulled out 55 carrots.  In the second bed she pulled out 101 carrots and in the third bed she pulled out 78 carrots.  She found that 6 carrots weighed one pound.  How many pounds of carrots did Kelly harvest?<n>Answer: 39<n><n>Input: Iris’ family is planning a surprise birthday party for her. In total, how many people are coming to Iris’ birthday party?<n>Answer: 23<n><n>### Input:What are you hoping to achieve when talking to someone? Choices:  A: getting fat B: get fat C: typing words D: falling asleep E: wasted time<n><n>### Response:		<n>Choices:A and B<n><n>##### Choice A: Getting Fat<n><n>The word fat is a verb derived from the word fat. So, as a verb "get" and "fat". So you can say, "I get fat".<n><n>##### Choices B: Get Fat<n><n>So in Choice C: typing words, typing means to write. Therefore as a verb typing you would say "I type words." In Choice D: falling asleep what does falling asleep mean? It means to fall asleep. Therefore "I fell asleep" I was sleeping and then after I fell asleep, I died.<n><n>### Input; You don't know something, what do you do? Choices: <n><n>##### A: learn it<n><n>B: I ask my friend<n><n>##### C: I ask my dad<n><n>D: ignore<n><n><n><n>### Response;<n><n>Choices A and B<n>A. Learn It- this means to learn. It is not a synonym of get meaning or anything else.

If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: The ratio of boys to girls in a family is 5:7. The rest of the bill is for the ambulance ride.  How much did the ambulance ride cost?<n>Answer: 1700<n><n>Input: It was time for Kelly to harvest her carrots that she had planted in three different beds.  In the first bed she pulled out 55 carrots.  In the second bed she pulled out 101 carrots and in the third bed she pulled out 78 carrots.  She found that 6 carrots weighed one pound.  How many pounds of carrots did Kelly harvest?<n>Answer: 39<n><n>Input: Iris’ family is planning a surprise birthday party for her. The party will include her 3 uncles and 4 aunts who have a son and daughter each as well as her brother and mother. In total, how many people are coming to Iris’ birthday party?<n>Answer: 23<n><n>### Input:The cabinets were imported from the south. John bought they because he knew that they would look good. If the boys are given $3900 to share, how much money does each boy receive?<n>Answer: 52<n><n>Input: Josephine receives a bill from the hospital for 5000$.  50 percent of the bill is for medication.  25 percent of the remaining bill is for overnight stays, and 175$ is for food.  The rest of the bill is for the ambulance ride.  How much did the ambulance ride cost?<n>Answer: 1700<n><n>Input: It was time for Kelly to harvest her carrots that she had planted in three different beds. How many pounds of carrots did Kelly harvest?<n>Answer: 39<n><n>Input: Iris’ family is planning a surprise birthday party for her. In total, how many people are coming to Iris’ birthday party?<n>Answer: 23<n><n>### Input:If I screw a chain ring onto something, what am I fixing? Choices:  A: necklace B: wall outlet fixture C: tool box D: computer E: motorcycle<n><n>### Response:		If we were to screw a chain ring to something, we are not fixing something since we are doing the opposite.  In other words, we are removing the chain ring from the piece it is currently connected to.  If we chose option E, we would actually be applying the chain ring to a motorcycle.  If the tool we chose is a wrench, option A is our correct answer.<n>

How many pounds of carrots did Kelly harvest?<n>Answer: 39<n><n>Input: Iris’ family is planning a surprise birthday party for her. In total, how many people are coming to Iris’ birthday party?<n>Answer: 23<n><n>### Input:Why would you not want to be working with wood? Choices:  A: blisters B: frustration C: being paid D: make money E: money<n><n>### Response:		I would not want to work with wood.  The hardest wood to turn into lumber is poplar. It's not because it's hard. It's because it's moist. To make it more solid, you need to dry it for two months!  When you're cutting your wood on the lathe, they need to be cut at the correct angle so that you don't get an uneven finish.<n><n>### Input You want to make a set of earrings from wood. You cut the wood on the lathe and put holes in the earrings.<n><n>### Response Cutting the wood with a lathe<n>The first step is to put a bit in your lathe. This bit determines what shape your piece will be. <n>Next, you take the wood, which is about 6 inches long and turn it clockwise on your lathe. While doing this, you are changing the shape of the wood. When it's done, you take the shape of the piece and cut it to the correct length for the earring.<n><n>### Next you have to do a different cut with a different tool.<n>Turn 60 degrees clockwise. (Use the depth of cut gauge to determine how deep this cut is <n>Turning a different direction requires another tool.<n>### I am cutting a part<n>Next, you take a 1/16 inch bit and cut it in a spiral pattern through both sides of the earring.<n>### Step 5 Cutting a circle with a 2 inch circle sanding drum.<n>The last step is the hardest because it requires special drilling machines. Turn the other side of the earring by 30 degrees counterclockwise. Take a 2 inch round sanding drum and cut a circle about 2-3 inches out of the middle of the earring<n>### Put the round sanding drum in a drill and sand all around the circle with the sanding drum. <n>### I have finished<n>### Final Step<n>Pick a nice bit! Now you can start earring making!<n><n>### Reference:<n>#####https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=w675zMgjw3o<n><n>##### https://www.youtube. com/ watch? v=w675 zMgjw3

Choices:(B) A: dog food B: food from the trash can C: bread D: fish E: tissue paper<n><n>### Response<n>If the question was "What would you normally expect the dog to eat?" the correct answer would be food, as dogs eat food and not fish or bread. For "what would you normally expect a food to be?" The answer would be food, for the question stated "what would you normally except the dog's food to eat?" and the answer can only be food and not bread.<n>

If the boys are given $3900 to share, how much money does each boy receive?<n>Answer: 52<n><n>Input: Josephine receives a bill from the hospital for 5000$.  50 percent of the bill is for medication.  25 percent of the remaining bill is for overnight stays, and 175$ is for food.  The rest of the bill is for the ambulance ride.  How much did the ambulance ride cost?<n>Answer: 1700<n><n>Input: It was time for Kelly to harvest her carrots that she had planted in three different beds.  In the first bed she pulled out 55 carrots.  In the second bed she pulled out 101 carrots and in the third bed she pulled out 78 carrots.  She found that 6 carrots weighed one pound.  How many pounds of carrots did Kelly harvest?<n>Answer: 39<n><n>Input: Iris’ family is planning a surprise birthday party for her. Choices:  A: fish market B: hawaiian waters C: gulf of mexico D: tropical sea E: south pacific ocean<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>We can answer this question by writing an if statement with the decision-making condition<n><n>If the user selects letter A, then print "A: fish market"<n><n>If the user doesn't select letter A, if the user selects either letter B or the C through E then print "B: hawaiian water"<n><n>Input:Johnny was looking in Hawaiian waters to get Blowfish.  But he caught a fish instead.  What fish did Johnny catch?  Choices:  A. Shark B. Blowfish C. Catfish D. Tuna E. Tiger<n>Answer: Shark<n><n>If the user prints shark then that's because the user clicked letter A meaning he was looking for blowfish.  Otherwise,the user clicked either B or D, E is a wrong answer. <n><n>### Inputs:<n><n>I had to use two if/else statements so that if the user prints tiger that would be a wrong answer because it isn't shark or a blowfish.<n><n>Input:Kate was in a petting zoo with a bunch of bunnies and lambs and rabbits and dogs.  What did she see in the petting zoo?  Choices: A: Dogs B: Lambs C: Rabbits D: Bunnies E: Raccoons<n>Answer: "A: dogs B: bunnies C: rabbits D: lambs E: raccoons"<n><n>### Response<n><n>We can now create a switch case wherein we check the user's selection and then print it out. <n><n>We create an if statement which has a variable called s.If the user selects letter "A", s would equal to "A" then we would print "The answer is dogs" and if the user selects another letter other than "A" then it would print "other".

The rest of the bill is for the ambulance ride. Use variables for the unknown numbers in each question.<n><n>## Answer<n><n>```<n>8, 12<n>```<n><n>## Explanation<n><n>Answer:<n><n>```<n>8/25 + 3/5 = 12/50<n>```<n><n>Explanation:<n><n>```<n>The problem reads: We have 25 apples.  It costs $6 for a carton of 12 apples.  How many cartons will we need?<n><n>Solve:<n><n>6x12 = 25a<n><n>6a = 25<n><n>a = 4<n><n>Hence, we will need 4 cartons or 48 apples<n>```<n><n><n>
