[Provide your response to the prompt here](https://github.com/HannahJones98/2019-FSA-Practice-Quiz/blob/master/sol.md)<n><n>## Contributing<n><n>1. Fork your preferred environment ([`develop`](https://github.com) or [`master`](https://github.cn/) ).<n>1. Clone your environment to your machine.<n>1. Create a new branch for your contribution.<n>1. Add your contribution.<n>1.`git add -A`<n>2. Add appropriate test coverage.<n>1. Add the new test.<n>1.`touch.coverage`<n>1. Test your contribution.<n>1`./.coverage report`<n>1. Run the tests with the environment code as it will be used in tests.<n>1`./install.sh`<n>1. Generate a documentation release<n>1.`make docs`<n>2. Add documentation changes.<n>1.`make docs-chg`<n>1. Commit your changes<n>2.`git add -A `<n>1. Generate the documentation.<n>2.`make docs-out`<n>2. Make changes to the Markdown files.<n>2.`vim -N`<n>2. Run the tests again.<n>2.`./install.sh`<n>3. Update the documentation as it may have changed.<n>3.`make docs-out `<n>4. Update the documentation release.<n>5.`make docs-out-chg`<n>6. Commit your changes.<n>7.`git add -A<`<n>8. Update the test coverage report.<n>9.`python test-output.py`<n>10. Upload this image.<n>11. Pull changes from your local repository.<n>12. Create a new Pull Request<n><n>## Notes<n>- This file will be tracked in the GitHub repo<n>- If you have any questions feel free to reach out to me [HJones](hjones@csclub.princeton.edu)<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: The ratio of boys to girls in a family is 5:7. The total number of children in the family is 180. If the boys are given $3900 to share, how much money does each boy receive?<n>Answer: 52<n><n>Input: Josephine receives a bill from the hospital for 5000$.  50 percent of the bill is for medication.  25 percent of the remaining bill is for overnight stays, and 175$ is for food.  The rest of the bill is for the ambulance ride.  How much did the ambulance ride cost?<n>Answer: 1700<n><n>Input: It was time for Kelly to harvest her carrots that she had planted in three different beds.  In the first bed she pulled out 55 carrots.  In the second bed she pulled out 101 carrots and in the third bed she pulled out 78 carrots.  She found that 6 carrots weighed one pound.  How many pounds of carrots did Kelly harvest?<n>Answer: 39<n><n>Input: Iris’ family is planning a surprise birthday party for her. The party will include her 3 uncles and 4 aunts who have a son and daughter each as well as her brother and mother. In total, how many people are coming to Iris’ birthday party?<n>Answer: 23<n><n>### Input:What is a great, but non-specific, overall benefit of exercise? Choices:  A: good health B: heart attacks C: relaxation D: rest E: fatigue<n><n>### Response:		<n>Answer: c<n><n>### Input A great, but non- specific, overall benefit of exercise, <n>is relaxation, B: heart attacks, A: good health, D: rest, C: relaxation, E: fatigue<n>### Input: What percentage of young people between the ages of 14 and 19 watch television for more than 3 hours a day? Choices: 0% B: 16% C: 30% D: 33% E: 46%<n>### Response: 28%<n><n>### Input a percentage of young people between 14 and 9 that watch television for more than three hours a day,16, 30, 33, 18 and 11.<n>### Input a table, with one column and three rows.  <n>Each row of the table has a number between 0 and 43.  <n>Each of the first two rows has a number that is greater than the number in the third row.  <n><n>### Response A:<n>2, 12, 19, 38, 43, 43<n><n>### Response B:<n>2, 32, 18, 27, 43,  32<n><n>### Response C:<n>2, 40, 38,38, 42, 43<n>

Choices:  A: fairy tale B: castle C: middle ages D: chess board E: doll house<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>When a game is first brought into production, the costs of the production process increase as fixed costs in the process are absorbed in the units of output produced. As the production process becomes more efficient and more units of output are produced, the unit variable costs (perfectly elastic with respect to the decision to produce more units of output) are the only costs in the unit of output. <n><n>### Instructions:When a game is first introduced into production, the costs in the production process increase as the fixed costs absorb output levels. As the production process become more efficient, the more efficient the number of units that are sold, and the unit variable costs are the only costs incurred.<n><n>### Input : The amount of money a consumer spends on a good is known as?<n><n>### Response : Price Elasticity<n><n>The Law of one price is an economic principle stating that when the price of a good is the same in two different countries, and other factors are equal, then the currency exchange rate between those two countries is dictated by interest rates and gold exchange rates.<n><n>### ANSWER : When the foreign exchange rate of two different countries is the same, then their currency exchange rate is dictated by interest and gold exchange rates.

How much did the ambulance ride cost?<n>Answer: 1700<n><n>Input: It was time for Kelly to harvest her carrots that she had planted in three different beds.  In the first bed she pulled out 55 carrots.  In the second bed she pulled out 101 carrots and in the third bed she pulled out 78 carrots.  She found that 6 carrots weighed one pound.  How many pounds of carrots did Kelly harvest?<n>Answer: 39<n><n>Input: Iris’ family is planning a surprise birthday party for her. The party will include her 3 uncles and 4 aunts who have a son and daughter each as well as her brother and mother. In total, how many people are coming to Iris’ birthday party?<n>Answer: 23<n><n>### Input:What is a place that could have hundreds of sporting goods store? Choices:  A: buy athletic equipment B: city C: espn D: town E: jerseys<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>#### Rationale:<n>The right answer here is a town. Sporting goods are almost always in a town or city.

If the answer is D, it is incorrect, but you must still show your work.<n><n>### Response<n>This is correct. The right choice according to what the instruction says is 'C'. We don't need to show the work if the answer is 'C'.<n><n>---<n><n># Chapter 1<n><n><n>### Instructor:Welcome to **Introduction to Programming in C**.  Today we will be talking about numbers.  We will learn how to declare them and manipulate them in different ways through programming.<n><n>### Question:<n>Can the number 5 hold values of 3 and 2 simultaneously?  What about 11?  How about 9?  Justify your response with facts or evidence.<n><n>### Answer1:<n>This is true.  The number 5 = 5 can hold values of 3 or 2.  This is logical because they are different values.  This holds true for many numbers, the two 5's I gave are the same, but 3 and 2 are different.<n><n>### 2)<n>This is true.  11 is definitely a number, because, it has a value of 11. The number can definitely hold 2 and 3 in it at the same time.  We can write:<n><n>```<n>5 = 3 + 2<n>```<n><n>Here, 3 and 2 both get added to make 3 + 2 which is 5.  So the number holds values.<n><n>###  3)<n>This is true as well.  9 is a number, but it definitely has the value of 9.  We can use the same logic that we did in case #2.  We can write<n><n>```<n>9 = 6 [mathematical subtraction] + 3<n>```<n><n>Here 6 and 3 get subtracted to make 9. When 9

Which of the following statements describes a conditional expression?   <ul><li>The value will be determined at run time.</li><li>The value is always set.</li></ul>  <n>     <ul><li>Conditional expressions let the programmer express a decision.</li><li>Conditional expression are used in the if, if... else, case and switch statements.</li></ul><n><n>### Instraction:<n>Answer the following true-or false question.<n><n>##  <n><n>### Instuction Answer the following  true-or false question<n><n>### Response<n><n>## Instructions:<n>Answer the following  true-and-false question.<n>True or false: If a number is an even prime, then it is either even or odd.<n>## Instructions Answer the following  true and false question.<n>## Demonstration: True or fals: If a number is even prime, then it will be even or odd.<n><n>### Input<n><n>If a number is an even number and even prime<n>## Demonstrations:<n> Input: 7 is even and even <n>## Demonstrating<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: A number is even or prime if and only if it is even and even prime.<n><n>### Response Answer the following multiple choice question <n>Answer a multiple choice question by matching the correct answer to the question or by correctly answering the question.

In the first bed she pulled out 55 carrots.  In the second bed she pulled out 101 carrots and in the third bed she pulled out 78 carrots.  She found that 6 carrots weighed one pound.  How many pounds of carrots did Kelly harvest?<n>Answer: 39<n><n>Input: Iris’ family is planning a surprise birthday party for her. Choices:  A: jigsaw puzzle B: chess game C: puzzle box D: jigsaw puzzel puxxle E: puxxle<n><n>### Response:		 C<n><n>### Input Choices:<n>A:  12 B:  15 C:  16 D:  17 E:  18<n><n>### Answer:<n>```<n>   "D":  17<n>```<n><n>### Input :  <n>Input: A family went to a restaurant that had a 8-item chicken dinner and a 4-item pizza dinner.  The total cost of both dinners with tax was $52.20.  What would the cost of the pizza have been if the cost of each item were $2 more?<n><n>Answer: The restaurant charges tax at a 8.5% rate. The tip is 20%. Then:<n>* 10% of the cost + 20% of the cost is the tip/gratuity.<n>* 8.5% of the cost +10% of the price is the sales tax. So the sales tax on the chicken dinner is $41/52.2 = $0.79 each, while the sales tax on the pizza dinner costs an additional $0.89.<n><n>The cost of the pizza would have been $40 - $49.92 = $8.37 less.<n><n>### Inputs:<n>A: 35 D: 55 E: 56 B: 45<n><n>### Output:<n>```<n>     "B":  55<n>```<n><n>## Challenge<n><n>### Input<n><n>```<n>A:  25 B:  39 C:  41 A:  34 B:  40<n>```<n><n>## Answer<n><n>```<n>A = 31 B = 39 C = 41<n>```<n><n>## Acknowledgements<n><n>Mentor: [Faisal Iqbal](https://github.com/Faisal-Iqbal)<br><n>Reviewer :<n>* [Shibu Sebastian](https://github.blog.shibusebastian.com)<br><n>* [Billie Mogensen](https://github.bmogensen)<n><n>## License<n><n>CC0 for code (free to use as you please)<n><n>*MIT License*<n>

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle. This result appears when the pointer is at an index that is one less than the number of elements to the left.<n><n><n>### Input1:<n>-You will be provided with 4 pieces of information about a dog show. (4 + k) k  =  3."<n><n>  input2 = input2.question<n><n>  answer = question.answer.includes [A..F]<n><n>  print answer<n><n>end<n><n><n>return<n>```<n><n>#### Rerun if response is incorrect<n><n><n><n>input = question<n><n>if input.input!= "input.question."<n><n>  input = question.input<n>else<n><n>return<n><n>end<n><n>question = question<n><n>if question.input2!= "input.question1"<n><n>    question = question.input2 <n><n>  end<n><n>question = question if question.question!= "Do you see a pattern to the ratio expressions in the questions?"<n><n>answer = question.question_answer<n><n>if question.answer.include? Choices:  A: industrial area B: museum C: barn D: school E: office<n><n>### Response:		 B<n><n>### Response Explanation:  This question is asking where to find an old copy machine, so naturally it needs to be placed somewhere that is not a school or barn.<n><n>The answer will be a museum but the choices do not give us a single answer, so the possibilities need to be eliminated.<n><n>Because an office is not necessary, this choice is eliminated.<n><n>We do not need a school, so school is eliminated and we only have four choices left, so A: B: and D: are not an option.<n><n>There are still three choices left, so we must use the information in the question to eliminate these.<n><n>C is for barn, and barns would not hold an old copy machine.<n><n>B: does not tell us where the machine would be found, but we know we must use B: not because we believe B: could hold a copy machine, but because they chose to include B: in the question for a reason, so B: must be disregarded.<n><n>This leaves A and D as the only two choices where an old copy machine could be found.<n><n>The answer is a museum because it holds all kinds of useful, old items.<n><n>### Input : An old friend asks you if you want to go to the same university as him. What is the result of multiplying these numbers.<n>### Answer:389. If you take the number in base 3, 2, and shift the numbers by one 1-space, 2 becomes 3, and 3 becomes 8. If you take the sum of the digits in the number in base 7, 7, and add the number in base 8, 389 is formed. This means that the 3 in 367 becomes a 7 in the base 7 and a 6 in the base 8.<n>### Input 68: 8*2=30-*68=40+11=51<n>### Answer: 11. If you change the base of a number in the multiplication, it will change your result. For example: 24=2^2. In base 2, 4=10.<n>### Input BASIC (programming language)<n>### Answer: "Hello, World!<n><n>### Input A programming language is written using instructions that tell the computer what the program should do. If the letter is a command that the computer can execute, then it will do so. Choices:  A: fearless B: english carrier C: courageous D: brave E: achromatic<n><n>### Response:		The answer is D, 'brave'.<n>A: Yellow is not a color of fearless, bravery is not an English word so the response cannot be A, B, C or E. A word that expresses courage, fearless or bravery starts with 'C' and 'C' stands for 'courageous' or 'courage'. Therefore, the color yellow is associated with 'B' which is brave or brave.<n><n>### Input : The color green is associated with which of the following? Choices: <n>A: Apathy<n>B: Aggravation<n>C: Amazing<n>D: Arrogance<n>E: Awakening<n><n>### Response :The answer is B, 'Aggravation'.<n>Let us make a list of words starting with 'A':<n>- apathy<n>- arrogance<n>- amazing<n>- aggravation<n><n>The list should be in alphabetical order. He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: The ratio of boys to girls in a family is 5:7. The total number of children in the family is 180. If the boys are given $3900 to share, how much money does each boy receive?<n>Answer: 52<n><n>Input: Josephine receives a bill from the hospital for 5000$.  50 percent of the bill is for medication.  25 percent of the remaining bill is for overnight stays, and 175$ is for food.  The rest of the bill is for the ambulance ride.  How much did the ambulance ride cost?<n>Answer: 1700<n><n>Input: It was time for Kelly to harvest her carrots that she had planted in three different beds.  In the first bed she pulled out 55 carrots.  In the second bed she pulled out 101 carrots and in the third bed she pulled out 78 carrots.  She found that 6 carrots weighed one pound.  How many pounds of carrots did Kelly harvest?<n>Answer: 39<n><n>Input: Iris’ family is planning a surprise birthday party for her. The party will include her 3 uncles and 4 aunts who have a son and daughter each as well as her brother and mother. In total, how many people are coming to Iris’ birthday party?<n>Answer: 23<n><n>### Input:What is important in a car when you are driving fast and come to a light? Choices:  A: stripes B: seat belts C: breaks to help stop D: tires E: radios<n><n>### Response:		<n><n><n>### Instructions:In a word problem answer choices are multiple and some are correct. What is the number of years that would be correct under the given multiple choice choices?<n><n>### Instuction:<n><n>### What is the answer to the sum of 3, -9, -10, and 7?<n><n>### What would you do if you got a flat tire?

He hadn't gotten what he needed in a long time.  He was suffering from what? Choices:  A: addiction B: fatigue C: relaxation D: headaches E: over eating<n><n>### Response:		In this question, David is sick. His body is getting weak and he needs a lot of nutrition. It could be that he is malnourished. For this reason he is shaking and he is hurt all over. He does feel like he can't move, he may feel like he can'T get enough oxygen into his body or he wants to cry, as many others do, because he is in pain from being sick for a long time. However, in order for him to overcome this issue, he needs to start eating more nutrition.<n><n>### Input : In the mall there are people, people, and more people. It is crowded.  How do the people express this? Choices: A: it was very hot B: oh, the crowds C: it is a lot of people D: I see a lot of people E: there is lots of people<n><n>### Response : This question asked "how do people express that the mall was crowded?" My answer is "it is a lot of people."  It is crowded because not only is more people entering the mall, but a lot of people are also leaving at the same time. This is likely going to create a problem of overcrowding in the mall itself, and may cause a bad situation for others as well as the people who entered.<n><n><n>### Input <n><n>### A: <n>#### Response

At a news event the microphone must be placed close to the sound source in order to pick up loud enough audio for broadcasting on television. Typically there will be more than one microphone boom in use at any given event. The boom arm can be removed if the microphone is placed at a spot where no action is taking place on television, such as behind or above the microphones at stock market events and at music and stage concerts.

Write an appropriate response that completes the request. It is suggested that before you attempt this coding exercise you review the documentation found in the Python3.5 Tutorial. Use code folding to eliminate clutter and make your code easier to read.<n><n>### Write code for:<n><n>```python<n><n>   class Solution:<n>      def maxProfit(self, prices):<n>   ```<n><n>   Here are the requirements for this exercise:<n><n>1. This solution only accepts one array of integers as input.<n>2. Your code must complete and return the maximum value of `maxProfit` found within the array of input prices.<n>3. For example, given `prices = [3, 2, 6, 1, 8]` the return value should be `6`.<n>4. The `prices` array is given in its sorted from lowest to highest value.<n>5. This solution must be tested in Python3.5.<n><n>### Input/Output: Your program should take in a single array of integers as input and return a single integer value that represents the maximum of `maxProfit`. The input array is provided in its sorted form from lowest to highest value in the form of `[lowest value, next lowest value, next lowest, next lowest, highest value]`. Be sure to test your solution’s performance in regards of runtime and memory usage. Use the code template when completing this exercise. Do not modify or add to the provided code template in any manner. It is also suggested that you create this solution from scratch. Do not utilize previously written code.<n><n>### Explanation:<n><n>### Instructions:<n>You can use the built in Python method `sorted` to sort the element in an array. The array that is input will contain the lowest value of the array and the element with the highest value of the array to its lowest price (i.e. the input array will look like 1, 2, 3, 4, 5).<n>This method is very useful as it sorts in ascending, and descending order. You can also sort the list in an ascending order using the method `[x for x in lsorted]` and the method `[x for y in lsorted if y > x]` where `lsorted` is the sorted list and ` x` is the value of the sorted list

Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n><n>### Response:		 D!<n><n>**Note: If at "train stop" and "vacations" is too broad (it is too broad)<n><n>### Input1:<n><n>**Note:  If "vacations" or "train stop" is too broad<n><n>### Input 2: If "vacations", "rail stop" or "train stop".<n><n>### Response2: D<n><n>### Input3: If "vacation", "rail stop", and "train station"<n><n>### Response3: D<n><n>## Solution:<n><n>## Example 1:<n><n>### Demostration:<n><n>Input: The car rental agency charges $31/day for a car or $199/week for a car that rents for an entire week.<n>Answer:<n><n>```<n>30 dollars is the same as 216 cents<n>so 30 * 2 = 60<n><n>$199 * 1=199 dollars<n>```<n><n>## Example 2:<n><n>### Instructions:<n>If Melissa's bill was 1250$, then 25% would be 312. Because  312 is close enough to the actual answer (482) we can use the remainder<n><n>```<n>1250 / 0.25 * 175 dollars is equal to 482.25<n>482 dollars is close enough to 482<n>```<n><n>#### Example 2:<n>```<n>1700 is the remainder because it is so close.<n>1700/(0.175 * 482) is equal to 479/98<n>5 of 98 and 1 of 479 are close<n>```<n>

So this leads to 50% of the amount that you gave me. I got there as I started with the highest whole number that divides x^2 and then the rest was easy to figure out from there.  <n>

De dealer zal de motor 500 euro's bijzetten. Als je de resterende bedraag 2800 euro betalen kunt je de auto met de motor afstaan voor 4120 euro.<n><n>### Werkwijze:<n>Langste afstand tussen waarde en bedrag 2800-3000 = -200<n>Dubbele bedrag 2 * 500 = 1000<n>Voorbeeld 500/4120 = 0,12<n><n>### Reactie:<n>U krijgt 760/1000 of 0,76<n><n># C<n><n>#### Instructie<n><n>- De meest uitgebreide set in de rijtjesrij aan de rand.<n><n>#### Reactie<n><n>- 3<n><n><n><n><n>

If the boys are given $3900 to share, how much money does each boy receive?<n>Answer: 52<n><n>Input: Josephine receives a bill from the hospital for 5000$.  50 percent of the bill is for medication.  25 percent of the remaining bill is for overnight stays, and 175$ is for food.  The rest of the bill is for the ambulance ride.  How much did the ambulance ride cost?<n>Answer: 1700<n><n>Input: It was time for Kelly to harvest her carrots that she had planted in three different beds.  In the first bed she pulled out 55 carrots.  In the second bed she pulled out 101 carrots and in the third bed she pulled out 78 carrots.  She found that 6 carrots weighed one pound.  How many pounds of carrots did Kelly harvest?<n>Answer: 39<n><n>Input: Iris’ family is planning a surprise birthday party for her. In total, how many people are coming to Iris’ birthday party?<n>Answer: 23<n><n>### Input:What does moving cars entail? The birth control pills should be stored inside the refrigerator instead of next to the toothpaste.<n><n>### Input : The ratio of boys to students in a classroom is 4 to 7. He knows each of his friends have different amounts of money available, but he does not know individual amounts for each of his friends. He knows he can borrow a total of 600 from them. Can you help Sam figure out how much money each of his friends can lend? <n><n>## Response to the question:<n>Sam should do this:<n>Sam should borrow 40 from the first friend, 20 from the second friend, and 20 from the third friend.<n><n>### How much money should Jason receive if 85% of the profit on a sale is from the sale of the products that cost $32?<n><n>### Response to the question: <n>Jason shoud receive $75 dollars.<n><n>### The cost of a dinner for two people at a restaurant is $35. What is the discount from the dinner's original cost when that cost is reduced by 50%?<n><n>### Discount answer:3%<n><n>### If a class has 8 students, is the probability that there is one girl in the class greater than 10%?<n><n><n>

The cost of the items is 40% of the sale price. The sale price of a certain item was 8 dollars lower than its original price. After the sale the original price of the item was $60. How much was the original price of the items?<n>### Response<n>A: 100<n>The original price was 100 dollars. Because the sale price was 8 dollars lower, the original price was 8 dollars more than the sale price. The original price was the first price the items cost, they were 8 dollars more than that. The cost of the item is 40% so we will divide that by 3 and that is 13.3. After finding what 40% was, you take it and multiply it by 3 and get 13.3 now. The original price was 8 above that for a total of 100.<n><n>###Instruction:In words, write the following expression.<n><n>A: <n>[x](2 * (3x - x) * (3x - 5 * (2x + 6))) *<n><n>Response<n>> <n><n>###Input:What did Paul do? If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: The ratio of boys to girls in a family is 5:7. The total number of children in the family is 180. If the boys are given $3900 to share, how much money does each boy receive?<n>Answer: 52<n><n>Input: Josephine receives a bill from the hospital for 5000$.  50 percent of the bill is for medication.  25 percent of the remaining bill is for overnight stays, and 175$ is for food.  The rest of the bill is for the ambulance ride.  How much did the ambulance ride cost?<n>Answer: 1700<n><n>Input: It was time for Kelly to harvest her carrots that she had planted in three different beds.  In the first bed she pulled out 55 carrots.  In the second bed she pulled out 101 carrots and in the third bed she pulled out 78 carrots.  She found that 6 carrots weighed one pound.  How many pounds of carrots did Kelly harvest?<n>Answer: 39<n><n>Input: Iris’ family is planning a surprise birthday party for her. The party will include her 3 uncles and 4 aunts who have a son and daughter each as well as her brother and mother. In total, how many people are coming to Iris’ birthday party?<n>Answer: 23<n><n>### Input:James drove his niece to her father.  Where did he drive? A: great grandparents B: grandparents C: cousin D: father E: mother<n>### Response: D<n><n>Input: Two of Bria’s uncles and aunt each have son and daughter.  In addition, Bria has two brothers as does her mother.  How many people does her family include?<n>### Response: A<n><n>Input: A restaurant is advertising for two kitchen staff. These jobs require the equivalent of 5 years of experience. How many total years of experience is the manager looking for?<n>### Response D<n><n>Input:  In a given year, 5048 days pass.  How many minutes do those days contain?<n>### Response C<n><n>Input: Betsy’s parents have a great-grandson, 1 granddaughter, 3 children, and a daughter.  How many children are there in addition to Betsy?<n>### Response B<n><n>Input: Which of the following statements is incorrect? A: You get 3 days off for every 4 you work. B: You can take a vacation every year. C: You need to work at least 2 days a week. D: You have to work a minimum of 120 hours per week.<n>### Response C

When retail stores put an item on sale, they want the shopper to buy the item and more. So, the shopper will buy more items and pay a lesser price for the items.<n><n>Input: In 2018, Amazon announced a new lineup of products. Smart phones usually have a lot more features than either a cell phone or a tablet, for example Bluetooth capability, and the ability to make video calls or to store and play music.<n><n>Input:  What other technology does the phone, tablet, and other types of electronic gadgets we use today, have common technology in them?<n>### Response:  They all share the same technology of Bluetooth, Wifi, and wireless charging and they can all transfer data to each other.<n>Input:  Name two products that fit the following description: Smart phone, tablet, smartwatch.<n><n>### Response(Smartphones).<n><n>### Input :  You bought an item at the grocery store, what was the total you had to pay after you paid sales tax and tips on the total cost?<n>### Response :  Let be price = 150 $<n><n>Input: You bought an item at a grocery store. He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: The ratio of boys to girls in a family is 5:7. The total number of children in the family is 180. If the boys are given $3900 to share, how much money does each boy receive?<n>Answer: 52<n><n>Input: Josephine receives a bill from the hospital for 5000$.  50 percent of the bill is for medication.  25 percent of the remaining bill is for overnight stays, and 175$ is for food.  The rest of the bill is for the ambulance ride.  How much did the ambulance ride cost?<n>Answer: 1700<n><n>Input: It was time for Kelly to harvest her carrots that she had planted in three different beds.  In the first bed she pulled out 55 carrots.  In the second bed she pulled out 101 carrots and in the third bed she pulled out 78 carrots.  She found that 6 carrots weighed one pound.  How many pounds of carrots did Kelly harvest?<n>Answer: 39<n><n>Input: Iris’ family is planning a surprise birthday party for her. The party will include her 3 uncles and 4 aunts who have a son and daughter each as well as her brother and mother. In total, how many people are coming to Iris’ birthday party?<n>Answer: 23<n><n>### Input:People celebrate by going places and riding rides.  What's one obvious place people might go to celebrate? The answer should have the word “A” as the answer, not the choice.<n><n>### Input : If the area is divided into smaller 1 1/2-acre lots, what is the cost per square foot?<n><n>### Choices: (A) 27; (B) 18; (C) 63; (D) 9.<n><n>### Response : Choice (C). The actual price per square foot depends on what the developer charges per square foot of house size. I can assume the developer is charging 240 dollars per square foot since that is the minimum of the choices. So the amount of square footage per unit is 4,800,000 square feet per unit, which would be 86,400 dollars per unit.<n><n>### Question:The average cost of a new car is $36,000.  If the average income of a person in the industry is 36,001 dollars, can a person afford this car?<n><n>### Response1 <n>The response is incorrect. The average cost of a new 2021 car was $42,205 on average. The average cost of an average car was 40k from 2009 to 2018. <n>

Task 1 is a scenario where you may respond by describing a problem and providing a solution such as this example:<n><n>"The school district needs to build a new high school in our city, but there appears to be a lack of property in the city for a new school site. Choices:  A: sew B: create art C: express yourself D: sing and dance E: write<n><n>### Response:		Singing and dancing<n><n>### Instructions:Complete the table and show your calculation with a step by step in python<n><n>|Column |Value |<n>:---:|---:|---:<n>Total |0 |<n><n>|Column |Choice |Value |<n>:-----:|:------:|---:|<n>Total |1 |5 |<n>|Column |Choice|Value |<n>:----- |:---:|--- :|<n>Total |2 |6 |<n>|Column |Choices|Value|<n>:----- |:------: |---:|<n>Total|3|7 |<n>|Column|Choices |Value|<n>:-----|:---:|--- |<n>Total |4|8|<n>|Column|Choises |Value|<n>:------: |--- :|<n>Total|5|9|<n><n>```python<n>def main():<n>    total=0<n>    for index in range(5):         #looping through five times<n>            choice = input("What is the choice?")      #asking options<n>            value = int(input("What is the value?"))   #accepting values<n>            if index == 0:                    #initial value is zero        <n>                total = value     <n>            else:                            #all values can be added together<n>                total += value                     <n>            if (value > 0):<n>                print("The sum of "+str(index)+" choices is "+str(total))<n>    <n>main()<n>```<n><n>> Input: Everybody has a little bit the creativity, but only few lucky ones get do what for a living.  Choices:  A. sew    B. create art   C. Express yourself   D. sing and dance  E. write<n><n>> Input: Sing and dance is the answer for the birthday party

How many pounds of carrots did Kelly harvest?<n>Answer: 39<n><n>Input: Iris’ family is planning a surprise birthday party for her. The party will include her 3 uncles and 4 aunts who have a son and daughter each as well as her brother and mother. In total, how many people are coming to Iris’ birthday party?<n>Answer: 23<n><n>### Input:Food must be freeze dried before it is taken on what vehicle? Choices:  A: fairgrounds B: friend's house C: space shuttle D: oven E: microwave<n><n>### Response:		Space Shuttle<n><n>### Instructions:<n>1. The answers to the questions may be found on your graphic organizer.<n>2. The answer is correct if it agrees with the graphic organizer.  If your answer disagrees with the graphic organize or is not a complete sentence, please rewrite your answer so it agrees with the question.<n><n>## Answer<n>1. A: The rent on the building each week is $190 for a rental that is only for an entire week.  11 days is more than one week, but the total price remains $190.<n>2. B: It will take the animal transport truck 40 hours to drive 60 miles at 60 miles an hour. <n>4. C: The boys get $50 for each day, and the girls get nothing. 7 boys are given $5000, and 7 girls are not given enough ($3900) to match the total of $5000.  This leaves $100 un-paid.<n>5. E: $1700 was paid for the ambulance.  The bill for medication was $175, and the total payments by food was $825.  <n><n>6. E: Kelly has 55 carroots in the first bag, 78 carroots the third, and she pulls out 101 total. There are 6 carroots per pound, and 39 pounds per pound of carrots. Kelly pulled up 39 pounds total.<n>7. D: It will include 3 aunts and uncles, her brother, mother, and her.  The mother has 1 son and 1 daughter.  It includes 5 people total.<n>

After a full day’s working, they can’t tell a person how many of each size of cake they’ve baked. However, one rule can be established: they’ve baked more of one size than another 8 times out of 10. The rest of the bill is for the ambulance ride. Choices:  A: accomplish B: make progress C: stop arguing D: do business E: concert<n><n>### Response:		<n>If my guess is right, and by 'tentative agreement' is the same as 'agreement-in-principle', I believe the correct response is "concerted on". I chose this option because "tentative agreement" has implications of having only some of the issues resolved and having an agreement by no means finalized, while "concerted on" suggests that the parties are all in agreement as to whatever terms have already been decided.<n><n>### Input:'It was a great idea to move the meeting from Las Vegas to San Francisco' what does the word "move" refer to? Choices:  meeting A: room B: date C: event D: time E: location<n><n>### Response:"move" is used in the context of a meeting being moved from one location to another. The phrase "move the meeting" suggests that a meeting was being held in a specific location and that the meeting has now been moved (i.e., relocated to) another location.<n><n>### Note:There is no option A or E, and you cannot select answer choices that are blank.<n>

What are the first 4 digits of the phone number? <n><n>### Response 1: The answer is 9935.<n><n>Input 1: In a number which contains a certain 7-digits phone number, every digit is between 0-9,  first 4 digits of a phone number is 993,2nd of digit is 5, which is two greater than the 1st digit and second to fifth digit is a repetition of fifth digit and rest is a repeating of 6th digit.<n><n>Answer: In the number<n>```<n>99357655774<n>```<n><n>## Other tasks<n><n>#### Instruction:Answer the question shown below.<n><n>*A 3: This can be done by dividing the number of times we have the number 7 in the string of numbers by the total number of numbers, then taking that by 10 to get the final answer. The reason that I did this was because one decimal place would take 10 digits to show 78. Whereas, the result of the division is in the form of 8 decimal places.<n>*A 4: I used the fact that there are a string of seven numbers separated by decimal points, and there is only one decimal place for each string. There were two of the same number with one of them being 0. Because there are only 2 of each number, we have two of them and have to add their multiplied by the second one, making the result 42.<n>*A 5: For the base string we can have any one of six given. My example uses the base string 2 but it could be anything. I am subtracting the value of each possible base string so 2 minus 3 is -1, 3 minus 6 is -3, 4 minus 5 is -1, 5 minus

Your program should start with an input prompt (in other words, you should accept input information from the user). The user’s input is tested using the “if” conditional. If the condition is satisfied, then a certain action should be performed. <n><n>#### Variable Declaration and Assignment<n>For a full explanation of variables and variables types, see the following documentation:<n><n>- [Lesson 17:Variable Declaration and Assignment](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JQdPw-m2zQM)

Choices:  A: feel sorry B: trust god C: cross street D: ride a bike E: lend money<n><n>### Response:		<n>D) <n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n>###  Input:I work in sales at a department store and make commissions when I sell stuff. I have a new boss that seems to like keeping a close eye on my sales. I know she's checking my reports, watching me work, and even sneaking up and hiding behind corners on the sales floor to watch. Will this mean that I can sell more stuff that month? Choices: <n><n>Input:I work in sales...<n><n>### Response<n>B) <n><n>## Instructions:<n><n>The number of days passed in relation to a starting date is a count. For example, if four days passed between Sunday and Wednesday then the count is 4. The number of hours passed in relation to a given time is not a count. For example: If 4 hours pass between 5:00 p.m. and 9:00 p. m. that doesn’ t mean that the count is 4, it’s just a measure of time passed. The correct way to express the number of hours pass between two times is to separate them with a forward slash. <n><n>For example: if four hours passed between 4:30 p. m. and 8:30 p.m. we would write the time as 4:30PM / 8:30 PM. The same is true for minutes and seconds. For example, four minutes and 22 seconds would be expressed as 4:02 / 4:02, and if a second passed five seconds later the expression would be 4:00 / 4:06.<n>### Instrucion:What day of the week the day of your birthday fell on?<n>### Demonstation:<n>Answer:<n>Answer:<n><n>### Instructoin:How many minutes of a given day passed when four minutes and 25 seconds passed?<n>### Demostration:<n>Answer:<n>## Answer:<n><n># My name is Md Zahedul Haque Ripon and my number is 11-4264. <n>

If his car gets 29 miles per gallon, how many gallons of gas will it take?<n>

She claims that the coach has medical expertise and should have known the boy had to be examined by a doctor. How do you think the rowing coach should respond?<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: 1) The coach should have consulted a medical professional and should have taken a quicker action to make sure is ok.
